description.zh-cn: 中华民国国民政府行政院长兼财政部长，亦是银行家及富商，孔子第75代孙。
description.en: A Chinese banker and politician in the Republic of China, he served as Premier and Minister of Finance of the Executive Yuan. He was the 75th generation descendant of Confucius.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治人物，孔祥熙的妻子，曾任孙中山的秘书。
description.en: Chinese political figure, wife of H. H. Kung, and former secretary to Sun Yat-sen.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治人物及军事家，曾任国民政府主席。
description.en: Chinese political and military leader who served as the leader of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治家、外交家、金融家，曾任财政部长。
description.en: Chinese statesman, diplomat, and financier who served as Minister of Finance.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代政治家、革命家，中华民国国父。
description.en: Chinese statesman, physician, and political philosopher, who served as the provisional first president of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 孔祥熙的父亲，清朝贡生，以教书为生。
description.en: Father of H. H. Kung, a Gongsheng of the Qing Dynasty who worked as a teacher.

description.zh-cn: 孔祥熙的第一任妻子，因肺结核早逝。
description.en: First wife of H. H. Kung, who died young from tuberculosis.

description.zh-cn: 中国历史学家、教育家，曾在国民参政会上揭发孔祥熙贪腐。
description.en: Chinese historian and educator who exposed H. H. Kung's corruption at the People's Political Council.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国银行家，曾任中国银行总经理，反对孔祥熙的财政政策。
description.en: Chinese banker who served as the general manager of the Bank of China and opposed H. H. Kung's financial policies.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治人物，蒋中正之子，曾批评孔祥熙为“大资产阶级”。
description.en: Politician of the Republic of China, son of Chiang Kai-shek, who criticized H. H. Kung as a 'big bourgeois'.

description.zh-cn: 中国女记者，曾任《新民报》采访部主任，报道了引发争议的“飞狗事件”。
description.en: Chinese female journalist, served as the director of the interview department of 'Xin Min Bao', and reported on the controversial 'Flying Dog Incident'.

description.zh-cn: 孔祥熙与宋霭龄的次女，是“飞狗事件”的核心人物。
description.en: The second daughter of H. H. Kung and Soong Ai-ling, and the central figure in the 'Flying Dog Incident'.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国的最高行政机关。
description.en: The executive branch of the government of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国掌管财政、税收、关务、国有财产等事务的最高机构。
description.en: The ministry of the Republic of China that governs revenue, taxation, customs, and national property.

en: Central Bank of the Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 中华民国的中央银行。
description.en: The central bank of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 民国时期的主要商业银行之一，后被国民政府增资控股。
description.en: One of the major commercial banks during the Republic of China period, later controlled by the Nationalist Government through increased capital.

description.zh-cn: 民国时期的主要商业银行之一，后被国民政府增资控股。
description.en: One of the major commercial banks during the Republic of China period, later controlled by the Nationalist Government through increased capital.

description.zh-cn: 位于北京通州的学校，前身为美国华北公理会开设的书院，孔祥熙曾在此就读。
description.en: A school in Tongzhou, Beijing, formerly an academy established by the American Board of Commissioners for Foreign Missions, where H. H. Kung studied.

description.zh-cn: 美国俄亥俄州的一所私立文理学院，孔祥熙的母校。
description.en: A private liberal arts college in Ohio, USA, and the alma mater of H. H. Kung.

description.zh-cn: 美国私立研究型大学，孔祥熙在此获得矿物学硕士学位。
description.en: A private research university in the United States where H. H. Kung obtained a master's degree in mineralogy.

description.zh-cn: 由孔祥熙在家乡太谷县创办的学校。
description.en: A school founded by H. H. Kung in his hometown of Taigu County.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国战时最高民意咨询机关。
description.en: The highest advisory body on public opinion in the Republic of China during wartime.

description.zh-cn: 19世纪末发生于中国清朝的武装冲突，对孔祥熙的早年生活造成了冲击。
description.en: An armed conflict that occurred in the late 19th century in Qing China, which impacted H. H. Kung's early life.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国国民政府于1935年起发行的法定货币，由孔祥熙主导推行。
description.en: The legal tender of the Republic of China issued by the Nationalist Government starting in 1935, implemented under the leadership of H. H. Kung.

description.zh-cn: 位于中国山西省，是孔祥熙的出生地。
description.en: A county in Shanxi Province, China, and the birthplace of H. H. Kung.

description.zh-cn: 美国城市，孔祥熙的逝世地。
description.en: A city in the United States where H. H. Kung passed away.

description.zh-cn: 孔祥熙是孔繁慈的儿子。
description.en: H. H. Kung was the son of Kong Fanci.

description.zh-cn: 孔祥熙的第一任妻子是韩玉梅，但她在1912年因病去世。
description.en: H. H. Kung's first wife was Han Yumei, but she passed away due to illness in 1912.

description.zh-cn: 孔祥熙于1914年在日本横滨与宋霭龄结婚。
description.en: H. H. Kung married Soong Ai-ling in Yokohama, Japan in 1914.

description.zh-cn: 孔祥熙出生于山西省太谷县。
description.en: H. H. Kung was born in Taigu County, Shanxi Province.

description.zh-cn: 孔祥熙于1894年从潞河书院毕业。
description.en: H. H. Kung graduated from Luhe Academy in 1894.

description.zh-cn: 孔祥熙于1905年毕业于欧柏林学院，后于1926年获赠名誉博士学位。
description.en: H. H. Kung graduated from Oberlin College in 1905 and was awarded an honorary doctorate in 1926.

description.zh-cn: 孔祥熙于1907年在耶鲁大学取得矿物学硕士学位。
description.en: H. H. Kung obtained a Master's degree in Mineralogy from Yale University in 1907.

description.zh-cn: 1907年，孔祥熙在家乡太谷县创办了铭贤学堂。
description.en: In 1907, H. H. Kung founded the Ming Hsien School in his hometown of Taigu County.

description.zh-cn: 孔祥熙曾先后担任行政院副院长（1933-1945）和院长（1938-1939）。
description.en: H. H. Kung served successively as Vice Premier (1933-1945) and Premier (1938-1939) of the Executive Yuan.

description.zh-cn: 时任财政部长孔祥熙于1935年11月3日颁布《财政部改革币制令》，推行法币政策。
description.en: As Minister of Finance, H. H. Kung issued the 'Ministry of Finance Decree on Currency Reform' on November 3, 1935, implementing the Fapi policy.

description.zh-cn: 孔祥熙宣布对中国银行实行管制，要求增发股票，将控制权交给政府。
description.en: H. H. Kung announced that the government would take control of the Bank of China, requiring it to issue additional shares to transfer control to the government.

description.zh-cn: 孔祥熙宣布对交通银行实行管制，要求增发股票，将控制权交给政府。
description.en: H. H. Kung announced that the government would take control of the Bank of Communications, requiring it to issue additional shares to transfer control to the government.

description.zh-cn: 在宋子文与上海金融家矛盾加深后，蒋介石让孔祥熙接替宋子文出任财政部长。
description.en: After the conflict between T. V. Soong and Shanghai financiers intensified, Chiang Kai-shek had H. H. Kung replace Soong as Minister of Finance.

description.zh-cn: 义和团运动期间，孔祥熙及其家人因运动导致的暴力而被迫依靠乡亲收容才得以脱险。
description.en: During the Boxer Rebellion, H. H. Kung and his family were forced to rely on fellow villagers for shelter to escape the violence caused by the movement.

description.zh-cn: 傅斯年在国民参政会上揭发孔祥熙贪污舞弊，不久后孔被免去财政部长职位。
description.en: Fu Ssu-nien exposed H. H. Kung's corruption at the People's Political Council, leading to Kung's dismissal from the post of Minister of Finance shortly thereafter.

description.zh-cn: 中国银行总经理张公权反对孔祥熙的赤字财政政策，并联合交通银行拒绝提供财力支援。
description.en: Chang Kia-ngau, general manager of the Bank of China, opposed H. H. Kung's deficit financial policy and, along with the Bank of Communications, refused to provide financial support.

description.zh-cn: 蒋经国曾批评孔祥熙为“大资产阶级”。
description.en: Chiang Ching-kuo once criticized H. H. Kung as a 'big bourgeois'.

description.zh-cn: 蒋经国曾批评宋子文为“大资产阶级”。
description.en: Chiang Ching-kuo once criticized T. V. Soong as a 'big bourgeois'.

description.zh-cn: 通过在新民报报道孔祥熙之女孔令俊滥用特权的“飞狗事件”，引发了公众对孔祥熙家族的强烈不满。
description.en: By reporting on the 'Flying Dog Incident', where H. H. Kung's daughter Kong Lingjun abused her privileges, in the 'Xin Min Bao', it sparked strong public dissatisfaction with the Kung family.

description.zh-cn: 孔令俊是孔祥熙的次女。
description.en: Kong Lingjun was the second daughter of H. H. Kung.
